messages.title: Fairer taxes that will help our country recover from the recession

keyPolicies.policyTitle: The Lib Dem fairer tax plan
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats are proposing to remove all income tax for those earning £10,000 or less, putting £100 back in the pockets of pensioners, £700 back in the pocket of everyone who earns over £10,000, and £1,400 back in the pockets of a couple each earning over £10,000. They are also pledging to introduce a new 'mansion tax' on houses worth over £2 million and to close tax loopholes exploited by the very rich.

issues.economy: The party is also pledging to raise tax thresholds to £10,000 a year, taking four million people out of income tax.

housing.content: The liberal Democrats promise that wealthy people will pay their fair share. To pay for the tax cuts in our fairer tax plan, we will introduce a new 'mansion tax' on houses worth over £2million.

endorsements.endorsement: The Lib Dems are promising to remove all income tax for those earning £10,000 or less from the tax system altogether.
The proposal to take the poorest workers out of the tax system is especially worthwhile
The party is also pledging to raise tax thresholds to £10,000 a year, taking four million people out of income tax.

quotes.text: The Lib Dems are promising to remove all income tax for those earning £10,000 or less from the tax system altogether.
The proposal to take the poorest workers out of the tax system is especially worthwhile
The party is also pledging to raise tax thresholds to £10,000 a year, taking four million people out of income tax.

images.caption: Nick Clegg's photo with the message "Fairer taxes that will help our country recover from the recession"
